content.title: Pradhan Mantri Bhartiya Janaushadhi Pariyojana
content.details: The scheme 'Pradhan Mantri Bhartiya Janaushadhi Pariyojana (PMBJP)' was launched by the Department of Pharmaceuticals, Ministry of Chemicals & Fertilizers, in November 2008. The branded (Generic) medicines are sold at significantly higher prices than their un-branded generic equivalents, though are identical in therapeutic value. Given the widespread poverty across the country, making available reasonably priced quality generic medicines in the market would benefit everyone.
benefits: Normal Incentive: Enhanced from ₹ 2,50,000/- to up to ₹ 5,00,000/- based on monthly purchases.
Special Incentive: One-time incentive of ₹ 2,00,000/- for specific regions and demographics.
Prices of Janaushadhi medicines are 50%–90% less than branded medicines.
Medicines are procured from WHO-GMP-certified suppliers.
eligibility: Individual applicants must have a D. Pharma/B. Pharma degree or employ degree holders.
Organizations or NGOs must employ B. Pharma/D. Pharma degree holders.
Reputed NGOs/Charitable organizations preferred in government hospital premises.
content.application_process: Online and Offline. Steps include visiting the official website, applying for Kendra, and submitting required documents.
documents_required: Drug license in the name of 'Pradhan Mantri Janaushadhi Kendra'.

faqs.question: What Is Pradhan Mantri Bhartiya Janaushadhi Pariyojana (PMBJP)?
faqs.answer: A campaign to provide quality medicines at affordable prices through dedicated outlets.

faqs.question: What Is A Generic Medicine?
faqs.answer: Generic drugs marketed under a non-proprietary name, equally effective and inexpensive.

faqs.question: How The Quality, Safety And Efficacy Of Medicines Are Ensured?
faqs.answer: Each batch of medicines is tested from NABL-approved laboratories.
